conclusion: Analyze the paths of the liquid from points A, B, and C to determine which container it will flow into.
Liquid flows from A to the right.
Liquid encounters a baffle that directs it downward from A.
Liquid continues downward from A and flows into container D.
Liquid flows from B to the right.
Liquid encounters a baffle that directs it downward from B.
Liquid continues downward from B and flows into container D.
Liquid flows from C to the right.
Liquid encounters a baffle that directs it downward from C.
Liquid continues downward from C and flows into container D.
All three paths (A, B, and C) direct the liquid into container D.
The liquid will flow into container D after passing through the baffles.
